Class Memory

  • java.lang.Object
    • Memory

  • public class Memory
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Memory(java.lang.String fileName)
      Creates an instruction memory object and initializes the memory to data read from a file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Memory

        public Memory(java.lang.String fileName)
       throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
              java.lang.RuntimeException
        Creates an instruction memory object and initializes the memory to data read from a file. File format: first value is an integer with the number of bytes for this instruction memory. Then file has 0's and 1's for the binary data to put into this instruction memory.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The pathname of the file to read into this memory
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the pathname does not specify a file that can be opened
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if invalid data is read from the file

    • Method Detail

      • writeToFile

        public void writeToFile(java.lang.String fileName)
                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Writes the contents of memory back to a file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The pathname of the file to read into this memory
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the pathname does not specify a file that can be opened

      • read32

        public boolean[] read32(boolean[] address)
        Returns the 32-bits that begin at the specified address.
        Parameters:
        address - The byte address where the 32-bit value begins.
        Returns:
        The 32-bit value read from memory. Index 0 of the array holds the least significant bit of the binary value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the address is not valid.

      • write32

        public void write32(boolean[] address,
                    boolean[] data)
        Writes a 32-bit value to memory
        Parameters:
        address - The address where to begin writing
        data - The binary value to write to memory. Index 0 of the array is the least significant bit of the binary value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if address is not a valid memory address, or if the value parameter does not have length of 32.

      • printMemory

        public void printMemory()
        Use for visually checking contents of memory

      • printMemory

        public void printMemory(java.io.PrintStream output)
        Use for visually checking contents of memory
        Parameters:
        output - The output stream.
